channel.title: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes" - The spell Aura of Vitality should only be accessible to Paladins.

item.title: Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded:
I did a quick pass through the warlock spell list and found two more spells that I think are mis-tagged as warlock spells:

project-image - should be just Bard & Wizard
abi-dalzims-horrid-wilting - should be just Sorcerer & Wizard

item.title: Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded: im not sure why that's listed as a warlock spell, looks like someone added that tag sometime in 2020 and we never caught it. can't tell what they were thinking unless it's part of some errata. just fixed the page, so it shouldn't show up anymore. thanks for letting us know!

item.title: Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded: To bring up another potential spell / class list issue: Why is Modify Memory listed as a Warlock spell and on the Warlock spell list? It's not on the Warlock spell list in the PHB or the additional Warlock spells in Tasha's.

item.title: Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded:
Ah, my bad then. I saw it listed on a couple of sites as Paladin only and it was mentioned on Critical Role, so I figured, that this had to be wrong.
Thanks for the reply.

item.title: Re: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded: Hey! You're definitely in the right place to report mistakes, however, in this case, Aura of Vitality was added to both the Cleric and Druid spell lists in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything.

item.title: Aura of Vitality: Wrong classes
item.content:encoded:
The 3rd level spell Aura of Vitality should - according to other sites - only be accessible to Paladins, but is also listed for Clerics and Druids.

I hope this is the correct way of reporting mistakes like this. Otherwise feel free to educate me.
